title: Statistical Computing with R
description: Data acquisition, cleaning, and management; use of regular expressions; functional and object-oriented programming; graphical, descriptive, and inferential statistical methods; random number generation; Monte Carlo methods including resampling, randomization, and simulation. 4 lectures.
prerequisites: STAT 252 or STAT 302 or STAT 312 or STAT 313, and CPE/CSC 101 or CPE/CSC 235 or BUS 290 or STAT 330
